intro: Lepismium paranganiense, commonly known as the Parangani nightshade, is a flowering plant native to South America, specifically found in regions of Ecuador and Peru. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like tomatoes and peppers. The plant is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale purple, blooming at night. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a velvety texture. Lepismium paranganiense is adapted to grow in humid, shaded environments, often in tropical forests.
